014package org.microbean.construct;
015
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Objects;
018
019import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
020import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
021import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
022import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
023import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
024import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
025import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
026import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
027import javax.lang.model.element.RecordComponentElement;
028import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
029import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
030import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
031
032import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
033import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
034import javax.lang.model.type.ExecutableType;
035import javax.lang.model.type.NoType;
036import javax.lang.model.type.NullType;
037import javax.lang.model.type.PrimitiveType;
038import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
039import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
040import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
041import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
042
043import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.CONSTRUCTOR;
044import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.METHOD;
045
046/**
047 * A representation of a domain of valid Java constructs.
048 *
049 * <p>A <dfn id="domain">domain</dfn> is a set of valid Java <a href="#construct">constructs</a>. A {@link Domain}
050 * provides access to a domain and its members.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>A Java <dfn id="construct">construct</dfn> is either a <a href="#type">type</a> or an <a
053 * href="#element">element</a>.</p>
054 *
055 * <p>A <dfn id="type">type</dfn> is a usage of a Java type, most commonly represented as a {@link TypeMirror}.</p>
056 *
057 * <p>An <dfn id="element">element</dfn> ia a declaration of a Java program element, most commonly represented as an
058 * {@link Element}.</p>
059 *
060 * <p>Domains impose constraints on the <a href="#type">types</a> and <a href="#element">elements</a> they contain, and
061 * on the kinds and semantics of operations that can be performed on them.</p>
062 *
063 * <p>This interface is modeled on a deliberately restricted combination of the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Elements}
064 * and {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types} interfaces.</p>
065 *
066 * <p>{@link Domain} implementations must be thread-safe.</p>
067 *
068 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
069 */
070@SuppressWarnings("try")
071public interface Domain {
072
073  /**
074   * Returns an {@link ArrayType} whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type} is {@linkplain
075   * #sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same as} the supplied {@code componentType}.
076   *
077   * @param componentType the component type; must not be {@code null}
078   *
079   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link ArrayType} whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type} is
080   * {@linkplain #sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same as} the supplied {@code componentType}
081   *
082   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code componentType} is {@code null}
083   *
084   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code componentType} is not a valid component type
085   *
086   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getArrayType(TypeMirror)
087   */
088  public ArrayType arrayTypeOf(final TypeMirror componentType);
089
090  /**
091   * Returns the {@link Element} declaring the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no such
092   * {@link Element}</strong>.
093   *
094   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
095   *
096   * @return an {@link Element}, or {@code null}
097   *
098   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asElement(TypeMirror)
099   */
100  public Element asElement(final TypeMirror t);
101
102  /**
103   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link TypeMirror} representing the type of the supplied {@link Element} when that
104   * {@link Element} is viewed as a member of, or otherwise directly contained by, the supplied {@code containingType}.
105   *
106   * <p>For example, when viewed as a member of the parameterized type {@link java.util.Set Set&lt;String&gt;}, the
107   * {@link java.util.Set#add(Object)} method (represented as an {@link ExecutableElement}) {@linkplain
108   * ExecutableElement#asType() has} a {@linkplain ExecutableType type} whose {@linkplain
109   * ExecutableType#getParameterTypes() method parameter is of type} {@link String} (not {@link String}'s erasure).</p>
110   *
111   * @param containingType the containing {@link DeclaredType}; must not be {@code null}
112   *
113   * @param e the member {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
114   *
115   * @return a non-{@code null} {@linkplain TypeMirror type} representing the {@linkplain Element#asType() type of} the
116   * supplied {@link Element} when viewed as a member of the supplied {@code containingType}; never {@code null}
117   *
118   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code containingType} or {@code e} is {@code null}
119   *
120   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code e} cannot be viewed as a member of the supplied {@code
121   * containingType} (because it is the wrong {@linkplain Element#getKind() kind}, for example)
122   *
123   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asMemberOf(DeclaredType, Element)
124   */
125  public TypeMirror asMemberOf(final DeclaredType containingType, final Element e);
126
127  /**
128   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@code payload} (the first argument) is considered assignable to
129   * the supplied {@code receiver} (the second argument) according to <a
130   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.2">the rules of the Java Language
131   * Specification</a>.
132   *
133   * @param payload the {@link TypeMirror} being assigned; must not be {@code null}
134   *
135   * @param receiver the {@link TypeMirror} receiving the assignment; must not be {@code null}
136   *
137   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code payload} is assignable to {@code receiver}
138   *
139   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code payload} or {@code receiver} is {@code null}
140   *
141   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either {@link TypeMirror} is not one that can take part in an assignment
142   *
143   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isAssignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
144   *
145   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.2 Java Language Specification, section
146   * 5.2
147   */
148  // Note the strange positioning of payload and receiver.
149  public boolean assignable(final TypeMirror payload, final TypeMirror receiver);
150
151  /**
152   * Returns the (non-{@code null}) <a
153   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-13.html#jls-13.1"><dfn>binary name</dfn></a> of the
154   * supplied {@link TypeElement}.
155   *
156   * @param e a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
157   *
158   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Name}
159   *
160   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getBinaryName(TypeElement)
161   *
162   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-13.html#jls-13.1 Java Language Specification, section
163   * 13.1
164   */
165  public Name binaryName(final TypeElement e);
166
167  /**
168   * Applies <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10"><dfn>capture
169   * conversion</dfn></a> to the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, which is normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard
170   * type}.
171   *
172   * @param wildcard a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; if not a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard
173   * type}, then it will be returned unchanged
174   *
175   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeMirror} representing the result of <a
176   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10">capture conversion</a> applied to
177   * the supplied {@link TypeMirror}
178   *
179   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code wildcard} is {@code null}
180   *
181   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#capture(TypeMirror)
182   *
183   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10 Java Language Specification, section
184   * 5.1.10
185   */
186  public TypeMirror capture(final TypeMirror wildcard);
187
188  /**
189   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateContainer} <dfn>contains</dfn> {@code candidate}, according to
190   * the <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1">Java Language Specification,
191   * section 4.5.1</a>.
192   *
193   * @param candidateContainer the putative containing type; normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard type};
194   * must not be {@code null}
195   *
196   * @param candidate the putative contained type; must not be {@code null}
197   *
198   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateContainer} <dfn>contains</dfn> {@code candidate}, according to
199   * the <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1">Java Language Specification,
200   * section 4.5.1</a>; {@code false} otherwise
201   *
202   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
203   *
204   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either argument is either an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
205   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
206   *
207   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
208   * 4.5.1
209   */
210  public boolean contains(final TypeMirror candidateContainer, final TypeMirror candidate);
211
212  /**
213   * A convenience method that returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} a {@link
214   * TypeElement} that bears the supplied {@code canonicalName}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
215   * TypeElement} (and therefore no such {@link DeclaredType})</strong>.
216   *
217   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
218   *
219   * @return a {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, or {@code null}
220   *
221   * @see #typeElement(CharSequence)
222   *
223   * @see #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
224   *
225   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
226   * 6.7
227   */
228  public default DeclaredType declaredType(final CharSequence canonicalName) {
229    final TypeElement e = this.typeElement(canonicalName);
230    return e == null ? null : this.declaredType(e);
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} the supplied {@link TypeElement} with the
235   * supplied {@link TypeMirror} arguments (if any), yielding a parameterized type.
236   *
237   * <p>Given a {@link TypeElement} representing the class named {@link java.util.Set java.util.Set} and a {@link
238   * TypeMirror} representing the type declared by {@link String java.lang.String}, for example, this method will return
239   * a {@link DeclaredType} representing the parameterized type corresponding to {@link java.util.Set
240   * java.util.Set&lt;java.lang.String&gt;}.</p>
241   *
242   * <p>The number of supplied type arguments must either equal the number of the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s
243   * {@linkplain TypeElement#getTypeParameters() formal type parameters}, or must be zero. If it is zero, and if the
244   * supplied {@link TypeElement} {@link #generic(Element) is generic}, then the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s raw type
245   * is returned.</p>
246   *
247   * <p>If a parameterized type is returned, {@linkplain DeclaredType#asElement() its <code>TypeElement</code>} must not
248   * be contained within a {@linkplain #generic(Element) generic} outer class. The parameterized type {@code
249   * Outer<String>.Inner<Number>}, for example, may be constructed by first using this method to get the type {@code
250   * Outer<String>}, and then invoking {@link #declaredType(DeclaredType, TypeElement, TypeMirror...)}.</p>
251   *
252   * @param typeElement a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
253   *
254   * @param typeArguments any type arguments (represented by {@link TypeMirror}s); must not be {@code null}
255   *
256   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}
257   *
258   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code typeElement} or {@code typeArguments} is {@code null}
259   *
260   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getDeclaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
261   *
262   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5 Java Language Specification, section 4.5
263   */
264  public DeclaredType declaredType(final TypeElement typeElement,
265                                   final TypeMirror... typeArguments);
266
267  /**
268   * Returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} the supplied {@link TypeElement} with the
269   * supplied {@link TypeMirror} arguments (if any), given a containing {@link DeclaredType} of which it is a member,
270   * yielding a parameterized type.
271   *
272   * <p>Given a {@link DeclaredType} representing the parameterized type corresponding to {@code Outer<}{@link
273   * String}{@code >} (see the {@link #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)} method), a {@link TypeElement}
274   * representing the class named {@code Outer.Inner} and a {@link DeclaredType} representing the non-generic class
275   * corresponding to {@link Number}, for example, this method will return a {@link DeclaredType} representing the
276   * parameterized type corresponding to {@code Outer<}{@link String}{@code >}{@code .Inner<}{@link Number}{@code >}.</p>
277   *
278   * <p>The number of supplied type arguments must either equal the number of the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s
279   * {@linkplain TypeElement#getTypeParameters() formal type parameters}, or must be zero. If it is zero, and if the
280   * supplied {@link TypeElement} {@link #generic(Element) is generic}, then the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s raw type
281   * is returned.</p>
282   *
283   * @param enclosingType a {@link DeclaredType} representing the containing type; must not be {@code null}
284   *
285   * @param typeElement a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
286   *
287   * @param typeArguments any type arguments (represented by {@link TypeMirror}s); must not be {@code null}
288   *
289   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}
290   *
291   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code enclosingType}, {@code typeElement}, or {@code typeArguments} is {@code
292   * null}
293   *
294   * @see #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
295   *
296   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getDeclaredType(DeclaredType, TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
297   *
298   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5 Java Language Specification, section 4.5
299   */
300  public DeclaredType declaredType(final DeclaredType enclosingType,
301                                   final TypeElement typeElement,
302                                   final TypeMirror... typeArguments);
303
304  /**
305   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link List} of the <dfn>direct supertypes</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror},
306   * which is normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED declared type}.
307   *
308   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; must not be an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
309   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
310   *
311   * @return a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of {@link TypeMirror}s representing the direct supertypes
312   *
313   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
314   *
315   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either argument is either an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
316   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
317   *
318   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#directSupertypes(TypeMirror)
319   *
320   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
321   * 4.10
322   */
323  public List<? extends TypeMirror> directSupertypes(final TypeMirror t);
324
325  /**
326   * Returns the {@link Element} responsible for declaring the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, which is most commonly a
327   * {@link DeclaredType}, a {@link TypeVariable}, a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#MODULE},
328   * or a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#PACKAGE}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no
329   * such {@link Element}</strong>.
330   *
331   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
332   *
333   * @return an {@link Element}, or {@code null}
334   *
335   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
336   *
337   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asElement(TypeMirror)
338   */
339  public Element element(final TypeMirror t);
340
341  /**
342   * A convenience method that returns the <dfn>element type</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
343   *
344   * <p>The element type of an {@linkplain TypeKind#ARRAY array type} is the element type of its {@linkplain
345   * ArrayType#getComponentType() component type}.</p>.
346   *
347   * <p>The element type of every other kind of type is the type itself. Note that the semantics of the prior sentence
348   * diverge deliberately, primarily for convenience, from those of the relevant section in the Java Language
349   * Specification.</p>
350   *
351   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
352   *
353   * @return the <dfn>element type</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}; never {@code null}
354   *
355   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
356   *
357   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-10.html#jls-10.1 Java Language Specification, section
358   * 10.1
359   */
360  public default TypeMirror elementType(final TypeMirror t) {
361    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY ? this.elementType(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType()) : t;
362  }
363
364  /**
365   * Returns the <dfn>erasure</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
366   *
367   * @param <T> a {@link TypeMirror} specialization
368   *
369   * @param t the {@link TypeMirror} representing the type whose erasure should be returned; must not be {@code null}
370   *
371   * @return the erasure of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}; never {@code null}
372   *
373   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
374   *
375   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code t} is a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link
376   * TypeKind#MODULE}, or a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#PACKAGE}
377   *
378   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#erasure(TypeMirror)
379   *
380   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6 Java Language Specification, section
381   * 4.6
382   */
383  public <T extends TypeMirror> T erasure(final T t);
384
385  /**
386   * A convenience method that returns an {@link ExecutableElement} representing the static initializer, constructor or
387   * method described by the supplied arguments, <strong>or {@code null} if no such {@link ExecutableElement}
388   * exists</strong>.
389   *
390   * @param declaringElement a {@link TypeElement} representing the class that declares the executable; must not be
391   * {@code null}
392   *
393   * @param returnType the {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getReturnType() return type} of the executable; must not be
394   * {@code null}
395   *
396   * @param name the {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getSimpleName() name} of the executable; must not be {@code null}
397   *
398   * @param parameterTypes {@link TypeMirror}s that represent the executable's {@linkplain
399   * ExecutableElement#getParameters() parameter types}
400   *
401   * @return an {@link ExecutableElement} with an {@link ElementKind} of {@link ElementKind#CONSTRUCTOR}, {@link
402   * ElementKind#METHOD}, or {@link ElementKind#STATIC_INIT}, or {@code null}
403   *
404   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
405   */
406  public default ExecutableElement executableElement(final TypeElement declaringElement,
407                                                     final TypeMirror returnType,
408                                                     final CharSequence name,
409                                                     final TypeMirror... parameterTypes) {
410    try (var lock = this.lock()) {
411      final List<? extends Element> ees = declaringElement.getEnclosedElements();
412      return ees.stream()
413        .sequential()
414        .filter(e -> e.getKind().isExecutable() && e.getSimpleName().contentEquals(name))
415        .map(ExecutableElement.class::cast)
416        .filter(ee -> {
417            if (!this.sameType(returnType, ee.getReturnType())) {
418              return false;
419            }
420            final List<? extends VariableElement> ps = ee.getParameters();
421            if (ps.size() != parameterTypes.length) {
422              return false;
423            }
424            for (int i = 0; i < parameterTypes.length; i++) {
425              if (!this.sameType(ps.get(i).asType(), parameterTypes[i])) {
426                return false;
427              }
428            }
429            return true;
430          })
431        .findFirst()
432        .orElse(null);
433    }
434  }
435
436  /**
437   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} is <dfn>generic</dfn>.
438   *
439   * @param e an {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
440   *
441   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} is <dfn>generic</dfn>; {@code false} otherwise
442   *
443   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
444   *
445   * @see Parameterizable
446   *
447   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.1.2 Java Language Specification, section
448   * 8.1.2
449   *
450   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.4 Java Language Specification, section
451   * 8.4.4
452   *
453   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.8.4 Java Language Specification, section
454   * 8.8.4
455   *
456   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.1.2 Java Language Specification, section
457   * 9.1.2
458   */
459  public default boolean generic(final Element e) {
460    if (Objects.requireNonNull(e, "e") instanceof Parameterizable p) {
461      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
462        return switch (e.getKind()) {
463        case CLASS, CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM, INTERFACE, METHOD, RECORD -> !p.getTypeParameters().isEmpty();
464        default -> false;
465        };
466      }
467    }
468    return false;
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} represents the (essentially
473   * primordial) {@code java.lang.Object} {@link Element}.
474   *
475   * @param e an {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
476   *
477   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} represents the (essentially
478   * primordial) {@code java.lang.Object} {@link Element}; {@code false} otherwise
479   *
480   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
481   */
482  public default boolean javaLangObject(final Element e) {
483    return
484      e.getKind() == ElementKind.CLASS &&
485      ((QualifiedNameable)e).getQualifiedName().contentEquals("java.lang.Object");
486  }
487
488  /**
489   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link TypeMirror} represents the {@link
490   * DeclaredType} declared by the (essentially primordial) {@code java.lang.Object} element.
491   *
492   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
493   *
494   * @return {@code true} represents the {@link
495   * DeclaredType} declared by the (essentially primordial) {@code java.lang.Object} element; {@code false} otherwise
496   *
497   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
498   *
499   * @see #javaLangObject(Element)
500   */
501  public default boolean javaLangObject(final TypeMirror t) {
502    return
503      t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED &&
504      javaLangObject(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
505  }
506
507  /**
508   * A convenience method that returns the {@link TypeElement} representing the class named {@link Object
509   * java.lang.Object}.
510   *
511   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} whose {@linkplain TypeElement#getQualifiedName() qualified name} is
512   * {@linkplain Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) equal to} {@code java.lang.Object}
513   *
514   * @see #typeElement(CharSequence)
515   */
516  public default TypeElement javaLangObject() {
517    return this.typeElement("java.lang.Object");
518  }
519
520  /**
521   * Semantically locks an opaque lock used to serialize symbol completion, and returns it in the form of an {@link
522   * Unlockable}.
523   *
524   * <p>Implementations of this method must not return {@code null}.</p>
525   *
526   * @return an {@link Unlockable} in a semantically locked state; never {@code null}
527   *
528   * @see Unlockable#close()
529   */
530  public Unlockable lock();
531
532  /**
533   * Returns a {@link ModuleElement} representing the module {@linkplain ModuleElement#getQualifiedName() named} by the
534   * supplied {@code qualifiedName}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no such {@link ModuleElement}</strong>.
535   *
536   * @param qualifiedName a name suitable for naming a module; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
537   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed module</dfn> will
538   * be returned
539   *
540   * @return a {@link ModuleElement}, or {@code null}
541   *
542   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualifiedName} is {@code null}
543   *
544   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getModuleElement(CharSequence)
545   *
546   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-7.html#jls-7.7 Java Language Specification, section
547   * 7.7
548   */
549  public ModuleElement moduleElement(final CharSequence qualifiedName);
550
551  /**
552   * Returns a {@link Name} representing the supplied {@link CharSequence}.
553   *
554   * @param name a {@link CharSequence}; must not be {@code null}
555   *
556   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Name} representing the supplied {@link name}
557   *
558   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
559   *
560   * @see #lock()
561   *
562   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getName(CharSequence)
563   */
564  public Name name(final CharSequence name);
565
566  /**
567   * Returns a {@link NoType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() bearing} the supplied {@link TypeKind}, if the supplied
568   * {@link TypeKind} is either {@link TypeKind#NONE} or {@link TypeKind#VOID}.
569   *
570   * @param kind a {@link TypeKind}; must be either {@link TypeKind#NONE} or {@link TypeKind#VOID}
571   *
572   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link NoType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() bearing} the supplied {@link TypeKind}
573   *
574   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code kind} is {@code null}
575   *
576   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code kind} is non-{@code null} and neither {@link TypeKind#NONE} nor
577   * {@link TypeKind#VOID}
578   *
579   * @see TypeKind#NONE
580   *
581   * @see TypeKind#VOID
582   *
583   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getNoType(TypeKind)
584   *
585   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.5 Java Language Specification, section
586   * 8.4.5
587   */
588  public NoType noType(final TypeKind kind);
589
590  /**
591   * Returns a {@link NullType} implementation {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() whose <code>TypeKind</code>} is {@link
592   * TypeKind#NULL}.
593   *
594   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link NullType}
595   *
596   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getNullType()
597   *
598   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.1 Java Language Specification, section 4.1
599   */
600  public NullType nullType();
601
602  /**
603   * Returns a {@link PackageElement} representing the package bearing the supplied {@code canonicalName}, <strong>or
604   * {@code null} if there is no such {@link PackageElement}</strong>.
605   *
606   * @param canonicalName a canonical name suitable for naming a package; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
607   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed package</dfn> will
608   * be returned
609   *
610   * @return a {@link PackageElement}, or {@code null}
611   *
612   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
613   *
614   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getPackageElement(CharSequence)
615   *
616   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
617   * 6.7
618   */
619  public PackageElement packageElement(final CharSequence canonicalName);
620
621  /**
622   * Returns a {@link PackageElement} representing the package bearing the supplied {@code canonicalName} as seen from
623   * the module represented by the supplied {@link ModuleElement}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
624   * PackageElement}</strong>.
625   *
626   * @param asSeenFrom a {@link ModuleElement}; must not be {@code null}
627   *
628   * @param canonicalName a canonical name suitable for naming a package; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
629   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed package</dfn> will
630   * be returned
631   *
632   * @return a {@link PackageElement}, or {@code null}
633   *
634   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code asSeenFrom} or {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
635   *
636   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getPackageElement(ModuleElement, CharSequence)
637   *
638   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
639   * 6.7
640   */
641  public PackageElement packageElement(final ModuleElement asSeenFrom, final CharSequence canonicalName);
642
643  /**
644   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a {@link DeclaredType}, {@linkplain
645   * TypeMirror#getKind() has a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED DECLARED}, and {@linkplain
646   * DeclaredType#getTypeArguments() has an empty type arguments list}.
647   *
648   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
649   *
650   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a {@link DeclaredType}, {@linkplain
651   * TypeMirror#getKind() has a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED DECLARED}, and {@linkplain
652   * DeclaredType#getTypeArguments() has an empty type arguments list}; {@code false} otherwise
653   *
654   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
655   */
656  public default boolean parameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
657    return
658      t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED &&
659      !((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
660  }
661
662  /**
663   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the (logical) {@link TypeElement} bearing the
664   * supplied {@code canonicalName}.
665   *
666   * @param canonicalName a canonical name of either a primitive type or a so-called "wrapper" type; must not be {@code
667   * null}
668   *
669   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
670   * TypeKind}
671   *
672   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
673   *
674   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code canonicalName} {@linkplain #toString(CharSequence) converted to a
675   * <code>String</code>} {@linkplain String#equals(Object) is not equal to} {@code boolean}, {@code byte}, {@code
676   * char}, {@code double}, {@code float}, {@code int}, {@code long}, {@code short}, {@link Boolean java.lang.Boolean},
677   * {@link Byte java.lang.Byte}, {@link Character java.lang.Character}, {@link Double java.lang.Double}, {@link Float
678   * java.lang.Float}, {@link Integer java.lang.Integer}, {@link Long java.lang.Long}, or {@link Short java.lang.Short}
679   *
680   * @see #primitiveType(TypeKind)
681   *
682   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
683   * 5.1.8
684   *
685   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
686   * 6.7
687   */
688  // (Convenience.)
689  // (Unboxing.)
690  public default PrimitiveType primitiveType(final CharSequence canonicalName) {
691    final String s = this.toString(Objects.requireNonNull(canonicalName, "canonicalName"));
692    return switch (s) {
693    case "boolean", "java.lang.Boolean" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.BOOLEAN);
694    case "byte", "java.lang.Byte" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.BYTE);
695    case "char", "java.lang.Character" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.CHAR);
696    case "double", "java.lang.Double" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.DOUBLE);
697    case "float", "java.lang.Float" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.FLOAT);
698    case "int", "java.lang.Integer" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.INT);
699    case "long", "java.lang.Long" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.LONG);
700    case "short", "java.lang.Short" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.SHORT);
701    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("canonicalName: " + s);
702    };
703  }
704
705  /**
706   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the {@linkplain Element#asType() type declared by
707   * the supplied <code>TypeElement</code>}.
708   *
709   * @param e a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
710   *
711   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
712   * TypeKind}
713   *
714   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
715   *
716   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if there is no unboxing conversion that can be applied to the {@linkplain
717   * Element#asType() type declared by <code>e</code>}
718   *
719   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#unboxedType(TypeMirror)
720   *
721   * @see #primitiveType(TypeMirror)
722   *
723   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
724   * 5.1.8
725   */
726  // (Convenience.)
727  // (Unboxing.)
728  public default PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeElement e) {
729    return this.primitiveType(e.asType());
730  }
731
732  /**
733   * Returns the {@link PrimitiveType} corresponding to the supplied {@link TypeKind} (if it {@linkplain
734   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}).
735   *
736   * @param kind a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link TypeKind}; must not be {@code null}
737   *
738   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() with} a {@linkplain
739   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link TypeKind}
740   *
741   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code kind} is {@code null}
742   *
743   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code kind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not primitive}
744   *
745   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getPrimitiveType(TypeKind)
746   *
747   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.2 Java Language Specification, section
748   * 4.2
749   */
750  // (Canonical.)
751  public PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeKind kind);
752
753  /**
754   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
755   *
756   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
757   *
758   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
759   * TypeKind}
760   *
761   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
762   *
763   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if there is no unboxing conversion that can be applied to {@code t}
764   *
765   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#unboxedType(TypeMirror)
766   *
767   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
768   * 5.1.8
769   */
770  // (Canonical.)
771  // (Unboxing.)
772  public PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeMirror t);
773
774  /**
775   * A convenience method that returns the <dfn>raw type</dfn> corresponding to {@code t}, <strong>or {@code null} if
776   * {@code t} is <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.8">incapable of yielding
777   * a raw type</a></strong>.
778   *
779   * <p>Overrides of this method must conform to the requirements imposed by the relevant section of the relevant
780   * version of the Java Language Specification concerning raw types.</p>
781   *
782   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
783   *
784   * @return the raw type corresponding to the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, or {@code null} if {@code t} is <a
785   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.8">incapable of yielding a raw type</a>
786   *
787   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
788   *
789   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.8 Java Language Specification, section 4.8
790   */
791  public default TypeMirror rawType(final TypeMirror t) {
792    return switch (t.getKind()) {
793    case ARRAY -> this.rawType(this.elementType(t)); // recursive
794    default -> this.parameterized(t) ? this.erasure(t) : null;
795    };
796  }
797
798  /**
799   * Returns a {@link RecordComponentElement} corresponding to the supplied {@link ExecutableElement}, <strong>or {@code
800   * null} if there is no such {@link RecordComponentElement}</strong>.
801   *
802   * @param e an {@link ExecutableElement} {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getEnclosingElement() enclosed by} a record
803   * representing an <dfn>accessor method</dfn>; must not be {@code null}
804   *
805   * @return a {@link RecordComponentElement} corresponding to the supplied {@link ExecutableElement}, or {@code null}
806   *
807   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
808   *
809   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.10.3 Java Language Specification, section
810   * 8.10.3
811   */
812  public RecordComponentElement recordComponentElement(final ExecutableElement e);
813
814  /**
815   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the two arguments represent the <dfn>same type</dfn>.
816   *
817   * <p>This method differs from the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)} method in
818   * two ways:</p>
819   *
820   * <ul>
821   *
822   * <li>Its arguments may be {@code null}. If both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is returned. If only one
823   * argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is returned.</li>
824   *
825   * <li>If the same Java object reference is passed as both arguments, {@code true} is returned (even if it {@linkplain
826   * TypeMirror#getKind() has a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#WILDCARD}).</li>
827   *
828   * </ul>
829   *
830   * @param t0 the first {@link TypeMirror}; may be {@code null}
831   *
832   * @param t1 the second {@link TypeMirror}; may be {@code null}
833   *
834   * @return {@code true} if and only if the two arguments represent the <dfn>same type</dfn>; {@code false} otherwise
835   *
836   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
837   *
838   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.3.4 Java Language Specification, section
839   * 4.3.4
840   *
841   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
842   * 4.5.1
843   */
844  public boolean sameType(final TypeMirror t0, final TypeMirror t1);
845
846  /**
847   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code et0} is a <dfn>subsignature</dfn> of {@code et1}.
848   *
849   * @param et0 the first {@link ExecutableType}; must not be {@code null}
850   *
851   * @param et1 the second {@link ExecutableType}; must not be {@code null}
852   *
853   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code et0} is a <dfn>subsignature</dfn> of {@code et1}
854   *
855   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
856   *
857   * @exception ClassCastException if this method is implemented in terms of the {@link
858   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)} method, and if each of the supplied
859   * {@link ExecutableType} arguments does not have an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE <code>EXECUTABLE</code>
860   * <code>TypeKind</code>}; this exception type is undocumented by the {@link
861   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)} method and so is subject to change
862   * without prior notice
863   *
864   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)
865   *
866   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.2 Java Language Specification, section
867   * 8.4.2
868   */
869  public boolean subsignature(final ExecutableType et0, final ExecutableType et1);
870
871  /**
872   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateSubtype} is a <dfn>subtype</dfn> of {@code supertype}.
873   *
874   * @param candidateSubtype the first {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
875   *
876   * @param supertype the second {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
877   *
878   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateSubtype} is a <dfn>subtype</dfn> of {@code supertype}
879   *
880   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
881   *
882   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubtype(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
883   *
884   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
885   * 4.10
886   */
887  public boolean subtype(TypeMirror candidateSubtype, TypeMirror supertype);
888
889  /**
890   * Converts the supplied {@link CharSequence}, which is often a {@link Name}, into a {@link String}, and returns the
891   * conversion, {@linkplain #lock() locking} when appropriate to serialize symbol completion.
892   *
893   * @param name the {@link CharSequence} to convert; may be {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be returned
894   *
895   * @return a {@link String}, or {@code null} if {@code name} was {@code null}
896   *
897   * @see #lock()
898   */
899  public default String toString(final CharSequence name) {
900    return switch (name) {
901    case null -> null;
902    case String s -> s;
903    case Name n -> {
904      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
905        yield n.toString();
906      }
907    }
908    default -> name.toString();
909    };
910  }
911
912  /**
913   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the element bearing the supplied <dfn>canonical name</dfn>, <strong>or
914   * {@code null} if there is no such {@link TypeElement}</strong>.
915   *
916   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
917   *
918   * @return a {@link TypeElement}, or {@code null}
919   *
920   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
921   *
922   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getTypeElement(CharSequence)
923   *
924   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
925   * 6.7
926   */
927  public TypeElement typeElement(final CharSequence canonicalName);
928
929  /**
930   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the element bearing the supplied <dfn>canonical name</dfn>, as read or
931   * seen from the module represented by the supplied {@link ModuleElement}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no such
932   * {@link TypeElement}</strong>.
933   *
934   * @param asSeenFrom a {@link ModuleElement}; must not be {@code null}
935   *
936   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
937   *
938   * @return a {@link TypeElement}, or {@code null}
939   *
940   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code asSeenFrom} or {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
941   *
942   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getTypeElement(ModuleElement, CharSequence)
943   *
944   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
945   * 6.7
946   */
947  public TypeElement typeElement(final ModuleElement asSeenFrom, final CharSequence canonicalName);
948
949  /**
950   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying <dfn>boxing conversion</dfn> to the primitive
951   * type represented by the supplied {@link PrimitiveType} argument.
952   *
953   * <p>The default implementation of this method calls the {@link #typeElement(TypeKind)} method with the supplied
954   * {@link PrimitiveType}'s {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() affiliated <code>TypeKind</code>} and returns its
955   * result.</p>
956   *
957   * @param t a {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@link TypeKind} that {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive};
958   * must not be {@code null}
959   *
960   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying boxing conversion to the
961   * supplied argument
962   *
963   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
964   *
965   * @exception ClassCastException if this method is implemented in terms of the {@link
966   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)} method, and if the supplied {@link PrimitiveType} does not
967   * have a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive <code>TypeKind</code>}; this exception type is undocumented by
968   * the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)} method and so is subject to change without prior
969   * notice
970   *
971   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code primitiveTypeKind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not
972   * primitive}
973   *
974   * @see #typeElement(TypeKind)
975   *
976   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)
977   *
978   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7 Java Language Specification, section
979   * 5.1.7
980   */
981  // (Canonical.)
982  // (Boxing.)
983  public default TypeElement typeElement(final PrimitiveType t) {
984    try (var lock = this.lock()) {
985      return this.typeElement(t.getKind());
986    }
987  }
988
989  /**
990   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying <dfn>boxing conversion</dfn> to the primitive
991   * type represented by the supplied {@link TypeKind} argument, if it {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}.
992   *
993   * @param primitiveTypeKind a {@link TypeKind} that {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}; must not be
994   * {@code null}
995   *
996   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying boxing conversion to the
997   * supplied argument
998   *
999   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code primitiveTypeKind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not
1000   * primitive}
1001   *
1002   * @see #typeElement(PrimitiveType)
1003   *
1004   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)
1005   *
1006   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7 Java Language Specification, section
1007   * 5.1.7
1008   */
1009  // (Convenience.)
1010  // (Boxing.)
1011  public default TypeElement typeElement(final TypeKind primitiveTypeKind) {
1012    return switch (primitiveTypeKind) {
1013    case BOOLEAN -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Boolean");
1014    case BYTE -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Byte");
1015    case CHAR -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Character");
1016    case DOUBLE -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Double");
1017    case FLOAT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Float");
1018    case INT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Integer");
1019    case LONG -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Long");
1020    case SHORT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Short");
1021    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("primitiveTypeKind: " + primitiveTypeKind);
1022    };
1023  }
1024
1025  /**
1026   * Returns the {@link TypeParameterElement} {@linkplain Parameterizable#getTypeParameters() contained} by the supplied
1027   * {@link Parameterizable} whose {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#getSimpleName() name} {@linkplain
1028   * Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) is equal to} the supplied {@code name}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no
1029   * such {@link TypeParameterElement}</strong>.
1030   *
1031   * @param p a {@link Parameterizable}; must not be {@code null}
1032   *
1033   * @param name a name valid for a type parameter; must not be {@code null}
1034   *
1035   * @return a {@link TypeParameterElement}, or {@code null}
1036   */
1037  public default TypeParameterElement typeParameterElement(Parameterizable p, final CharSequence name) {
1038    Objects.requireNonNull(p, "p");
1039    Objects.requireNonNull(name, "name");
1040    while (p != null) {
1041      // A call to getTypeParameters() does not cause symbol completion, but name acquisition also needs to be
1042      // serialized globally.
1043      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
1044        for (final TypeParameterElement tpe : p.getTypeParameters()) {
1045          if (tpe.getSimpleName().contentEquals(name)) {
1046            return tpe;
1047          }
1048        }
1049      }
1050      p = switch (p) {
1051      case ExecutableElement ee -> (Parameterizable)ee.getEnclosingElement();
1052      case TypeElement te -> (Parameterizable)te.getEnclosingElement();
1053      default -> null;
1054      };
1055    }
1056    return null;
1057  }
1058
1059  /**
1060   * A convenience method that returns the {@link TypeVariable} {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#asType() declared by}
1061   * the {@link TypeParameterElement} {@linkplain Parameterizable#getTypeParameters() contained} by the supplied {@link
1062   * Parameterizable} whose {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#getSimpleName() name} {@linkplain
1063   * Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) is equal to} the supplied {@code name}, <strong>or {@code null} if there is no
1064   * such {@link TypeParameterElement} or {@link TypeVariable}</strong>.
1065   *
1066   * @param p a {@link Parameterizable}; must not be {@code null}
1067   *
1068   * @param name a name valid for a type parameter; must not be {@code null}
1069   *
1070   * @return a {@link TypeVariable}, or {@code null}
1071   *
1072   * @see #typeParameterElement(Parameterizable, CharSequence)
1073   */
1074  public default TypeVariable typeVariable(Parameterizable p, final CharSequence name) {
1075    final TypeParameterElement e = this.typeParameterElement(p, name);
1076    return e == null ? null : (TypeVariable)e.asType();
1077  }
1078
1079  /**
1080   * A convenience method that returns the first {@link VariableElement} with a {@linkplain ElementKind#isVariable()
1081   * variable <code>ElementKind</code>} and {@linkplain Element#getSimpleName() bearing} the supplied {@code simpleName}
1082   * that the supplied {@code enclosingElement} {@linkplain Element#getEnclosedElements() encloses}, <strong>or {@code
1083   * null} if there is no such {@link VariableElement}</strong>.
1084   *
1085   * @param enclosingElement an {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
1086   *
1087   * @param simpleName a {@link CharSequence}; must not be {@code null}
1088   *
1089   * @return a {@link VariableElement}, or {@code null}
1090   *
1091   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
1092   *
1093   * @see Element#getEnclosedElements()
1094   *
1095   * @see ElementKind#isVariable()
1096   *
1097   * @see Element#getSimpleName()
1098   *
1099   * @see VariableElement
1100   */
1101  public default VariableElement variableElement(final Element enclosingElement, final CharSequence simpleName) {
1102    Objects.requireNonNull(simpleName, "simpleName");
1103    try (var lock = lock()) {
1104      for (final Element ee : enclosingElement.getEnclosedElements()) {
1105        if (ee.getKind().isVariable() && ee.getSimpleName().contentEquals(simpleName)) {
1106          return (VariableElement)ee;
1107        }
1108      }
1109    }
1110    return null;
1111  }
1112
1113  /**
1114   * A convenience method that returns a new {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() with a
1115   * <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#WILDCARD}, an {@linkplain WildcardType#getExtendsBound() extends bound}
1116   * of {@code null}, and a {@linkplain WildcardType#getSuperBound() super bound} of {@code null}.
1117   *
1118   * @return a new, non-{@code null} {@link WildcardType}
1119   *
1120   * @see #wildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1121   *
1122   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getWildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1123   *
1124   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
1125   * 4.5.1
1126   */
1127  public default WildcardType wildcardType() {
1128    return this.wildcardType(null, null);
1129  }
1130
1131  /**
1132   * Returns a new {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() with a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link
1133   * TypeKind#WILDCARD}, an {@linkplain WildcardType#getExtendsBound() extends bound} of the supplied {@code
1134   * extendsBound}, and a {@linkplain WildcardType#getSuperBound() super bound} of the supplied {@code superBound}.
1135   *
1136   * <p>Any argument may be {@code null}. Both arguments may not be non-{@code null}.</p>
1137   *
1138   * @param extendsBound the upper bound of the new {@link WildcardType}; may be {@code null}
1139   *
1140   * @param superBound the lower bound of the new {@link WildcardType}; may be {@code null}
1141   *
1142   * @return a new, non-{@code null} {@link WildcardType}
1143   *
1144   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if both arguments are non-{@code null} or otherwise unsuitable for being the
1145   * bounds of a {@link WildcardType}
1146   *
1147   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getWildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1148   *
1149   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
1150   * 4.5.1
1151   */
1152  public WildcardType wildcardType(TypeMirror extendsBound, TypeMirror superBound);
1153
1154}
